cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the Yucatan Peninsula, then expected to cross the central Gulf of Mexico and approach the north-western Gulf Coast (TX/LA) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast near the TX-LA border (south-west Louisiana / upper Texas coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch – Punta Herrero to Cancun (eastern Yucatan)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning – Punta Herrero to Dzilam (eastern-northeastern Yucatan)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula first, then entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible (34-kt probability up to 36%, 50-kt up to 14%) late Tuesday into Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge >3 ft along the upper Texas coast if the center makes landfall east of Galveston.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands possible with totals exceeding 4 inches, producing flash-flood concerns.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas and dangerous rip currents could require port closure or movement restrictions.
